definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: They define an "excellent paper" as one that is highly cited by other researchers.
sentences.chinese: 他们把“优秀论文”定义为引用量高的文章。

sentences.english: If we think about it, wind chill is an ill-defined concept.
sentences.chinese: 仔细想来，风寒是一个定义不清楚的概念。

sentences.english: In addition, the definition for twisted-pair is different in different network standard.
sentences.chinese: 另外，不同网络标准中对双绞线线脚定义也是不同的。

sentences.english: The localization of the definition of significant figures in the current teaching materials is verified with example analyses.
sentences.chinese: 以实例分析了现行教材中有效数字定义的局限性。

sentences.english: My system is whatever's inside the box.
Supported user-defined unread notification of automatical protection.
sentences.chinese: 支持用户自定义的新未读消息弹出提示。

sentences.english: This error will disappear after the main program has been defined.
sentences.chinese: 在您完成主程序的定义之后，该错误将会消失。

sentences.english: Consideration can be defined as mutual promises.
sentences.chinese: 双价可定义为相互的承诺。

sentences.english: "Small" is a subjective term, so a "small" release depends upon your definition.
sentences.chinese: “小”是一个主观性的词语，取决于您的定义。

sentences.english: Isomers are defined as compounds having the same formula but different structures.
sentences.chinese: 异构体被定义为化学式相同而结构不同的化合物。

sentences.english: You define the flows through handlers.
sentences.chinese: 您通过处理程序定义流。

sentences.english: To start, we will define and fill an employee table.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们将定义和填充一个雇员表。

sentences.english: Carnap tried to define causality from the angle of semantics.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔纳普试图从语义学角度来定义因果必然性。

sentences.english: Defines a base class for all management-related exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 为所有与管理相关的异常定义基类。

sentences.english: You could define fields to be accessed relationally on a per-form or per-database basis.
sentences.chinese: 可以按照表或者数据库定义以关系方式访问的字段。

definition: in a nutshell/to put it briefly
in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
to determine the nature (usually of error or crime)/to determine chemical composition/qualitative/fixed
